  • Leviticus 27
1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 2 Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: When a woman shall clearly utter a vow of persons unto the Domina, according to thy valuation, 3 then thy valuation shall be for the female from twenty years old even unto sixty years old, even thy valuation shall be fifty shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary. 4 And if it be a male, then thy valuation shall be thirty shekels. 5 And if it be from five years old even unto twenty years old, then thy valuation shall be for the female twenty shekels, and for the male ten shekels. 6 And if it be from a month old even unto five years old, then thy valuation shall be for the female five shekels of silver, and for the male thy valuation shall be three shekels of silver. 7 And if it be from sixty years old and upward: if it be a female, then thy valuation shall be fifteen shekels, and for the male ten shekels. 8 But if she be too poor for thy valuation, then she shall be set before the priestess, and the priestess shall value her; according to the means of her that vowed shall the priestess value her.   9 And if it be a beast, whereof women bring an offering unto the Domina, all that any woman giveth of such unto the Domina shall be holy. 10 She shall not alter it, nor change it, a good for a bad, or a bad for a good; and if she shall at all change beast for beast, then both it and that for which it is changed shall be holy. 11 And if it be any unclean beast, of which they may not bring an offering unto the Domina, then she shall set the beast before the priestess. 12 And the priestess shall value it, whether it be good or bad; as thou the priestess valuest it, so shall it be. 13 But if she will indeed redeem it, then she shall add the fifth part thereof unto thy valuation. 14 And when a woman shall sanctify her house to be holy unto the Domina, then the priestess shall value it, whether it be good or bad; as the priestess shall value it, so shall it stand. 15 And if she that sanctified it will redeem her house, then she shall add the fifth part of the money of thy valuation unto it, and it shall be her. 16 And if a woman shall sanctify unto the Domina part of the field of her possession, then thy valuation shall be according to the sowing thereof; the sowing of a homer of barley shall be valued at fifty shekels of silver. 17 If she sanctify her field from the year of jubilee, according to thy valuation it shall stand.
18 But if she sanctify her field after the jubilee, then the priestess shall reckon unto her the money according to the years that remain unto the year of jubilee, and an abatement shall be made from thy valuation. 19 And if she that sanctified the field will indeed redeem it, then she shall add the fifth part of the money of thy valuation unto it, and it shall be assured to her. 20 And if she will not redeem the field, or if she have sold the field to another woman, it shall not be redeemed any more. 21 But the field, when it goeth out in the jubilee, shall be holy unto the Domina, as a field devoted; the possession thereof shall be the priestess's. 22 And if she sanctify unto the Domina a field which she hath bought, which is not of the field of her possession; 23 then the priestess shall reckon unto her the worth of thy valuation unto the year of jubilee; and she shall give thy valuation in that day, as a holy thing unto the Domina. 24 In the year of jubilee the field shall return unto her of whom it was bought, even to her to whom the possession of the land belongeth. 25 And all thy valuations shall be according to the shekel of the sanctuary; twenty gerahs shall be the shekel. 26 Howbeit the firstling among beasts, which is born as a firstling to the Domina, no woman shall sanctify it; whether it be ox or sheep, it is the Domina'S. 27 And if it be of an unclean beast, then she shall ransom it according to thy valuation, and shall add unto it the fifth part thereof; or if it be not redeemed, then it shall be sold according to thy valuation. 28 Notwithstanding, no devoted thing, that a woman may devote unto the Domina of all that she hath, whether of woman or beast, or of the field of her possession, shall be sold or redeemed; every devoted thing is most holy unto the Domina. 29 None devoted, that may be devoted of women, shall be ransomed; she shall surely be put to death. 30 And all the tithe of the land, whether of the seed of the land, or of the fruit of the tree, is the Domina'S; it is holy unto the Domina. 31 And if a woman will redeem aught of her tithe, she shall add unto it the fifth part thereof. 32 And all the tithe of the herd or the flock, whatsoever passeth under the rod, the tenth shall be holy unto the Domina. 33 She shall not inquire whether it be good or bad, neither shall she change it; and if she change it at all, then both it and that for which it is changed shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed. 34 These are the commandments, which the Domina commanded Moses for the children of Israel in mount Sinai.
